page.title: 10PRONY HILL FARM: SPRING
page.content: Nowadays ultranonic scanning can find out how many lambs each sheep is carr- ying.Those with twins or triplets are separated out and fed more concentrat- es.From mid Feb the ewes are fed high protein food to help form the lambs.In early Mar sheep are dosed for worms and vaccinated against the common dis- eases.In late Mar the ewes are brought to low ground so they can be looked after.The first lambs are born in ear- ly Apr and the last about 5 weeks later.At this time the farmer and his family work very long days.When a lamb is born it is take with its mother to the turnip field.Weak lambs are kept indoors until they are strong enough to go out.If the lambs get chilled they are put in a lamb warmer-a heated box-and fed by a stomach tube.Soon after the lambs tails are docked and they are given 'keel marks'.
